content.description: Sustained climbing on pockets and edges, following the bolt line and going slightly left from the start. Work your feet ! Eases up after the third clip. There is definitely still some loose stuff on the route
content.location: In an alcove in the bushes above the terraced steps, in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Climb the slightly overhung wall past a very large cobble or inclusion on small featrues and cobbles to the anchor.
This route climbs the pebbly, featured slab, right of "Gentle Barn." Pull up on small holes and features. Higher up the features diminish as the angle eases.
content.location: This route is near the left end of the slab. The 2nd line of bolts for the left.

climbs.name: Rawhide
climbs.fa: Jeffrey Thomas, Benjamin Chapman, & Pam Neal (October 23, 2021)

content.description: The climbing on Rawhide is reminicant of the Waco Wall, with small sharp holds and great friction. The rock is very compact with small, well bonded xenoliths. From the north end of the Panhandle climb the apron to a set of holes situated in a horizontal crease where the apron steepens to vertical. Solve the high step sequence utilizing side pulls from shallow crescent shaped holds. Work onto a knob on the dike and climb small sharp holds to a mantle and the anchor.
content.location: Far north end of the Panhandle where the cliff band disappears into the vegetation, eight feet left of Biscuit, The route can be identified by two distinctive dikes diagonaling across the face.

content.description: Pull sharp features up the right side of the blunt arete.
content.location: Right of the gulley that separates The Panhandle from the slab west of the Heart Wall.

content.description: Slab climbing on sloping hand and footholds, some high steps and reaches. Short,Â better than it looks.
content.location: Left most route on the Panhandle. 10' left of Gentle Barn.

content.description: The easiest route on The Panhandle with one 5.8ish move near the anchors. Start on the boulder and make a bouldery move and work your way up and left following the holes and pockets.
content.location: Gentle Barn is the fourth line of bolts from the left edge of the Panhandle. The route follows a band of cobbles and aggregate from a pronounced step in the trail formed by a boulder, in front of the nice bench.

climbs.name: Fraccident Prone
climbs.fa: Matt Oliphant, Mike Draper, & William Leventhal (April 2015)

content.description: Climb small features and cobbles on the steep wall directly below Humpty Dumpty. The initial moves to the 1st bolt are the crux.
content.location: On the slab below Humpty Dumpty. Between Powderkeg and Deadwood.

content.description: Starts with bouldery moves through small pockets and the remnants of a flake up towards a big hole. After you clip the third bolt, the angle kicks back a little, but rock also gets less featured.
Climbing on delicate edges and flakes, without a distinct crux. Watch out for loose stuff, and do not expect the typical TC pockets here.
content.protection: 5 bolts to ring anchors (shared with Stick to Your Guns)
content.location: Now the 5th route from the left. Starts on the left side of the large bush at the base, 20 feet right of Gentle Barn.

content.description: Climb the slightly overhung wall on small features and cobbles right of the black water streak.
content.location: Right of Born Again Texan and Fraccident Prone. Right end of the Panhandle.

climbs.name: Born Again Texan
climbs.fa: Ben Chapman,  Pam Neal, & Lance Ranzer (2018)

content.description: Climb the slab to get into a tight chimney. Work up the chimney to where it ends and move left onto the face utilizing a unique cobble with a constriction at either end. Continue climbing into a large bowl or depression, then move right onto the face. Climb the face using an odd crack-like feature and knobs to the anchor.
Climb the apron to a horizontal. Continue up the face on features and cobbles.
content.location: Far left side of the Panhandle Wall.

content.description: A bouldery start leads up and left to the 1st bolt. Follow the light brown, left leaning, "bacon rind" band to the left and then up to the anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts & an anchor with a ring and chain.
content.location: "Bacon Sandwich"  begins 25 ft right of "Drill Baby Drill" and right of the large bush. This is the 4th route from the left.
